SENT.plain: A patient in whom transesophageal echocardiography was performed to evaluate a possible source of cerebral embolization
The fact that the probe could not be passed easily beyond 35 cm from the incisors suggested esophageal obstruction or compression
A mass was seen posterior to the left atrium that was heterogenous and contained blood vessels, suggesting a malignancy
There were no complications of the procedure
Esophageal adenocarcinoma was confirmed on biopsy
Transesophageal echocardiography may be diagnostic of paracardiac mediastinal masses, both benign and malignant
Great care must be taken if passage of the probe through the esophagus is met with resistance, to avoid serious complications
